triana.types.clipins

Class TimerClipIn

  • java.lang.Object
    • triana.types.clipins.TimerClipIn
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, ClipIn

    public class TimerClipIn
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClipIn
    A clip-in which records the amount of time spent in each task it passes through
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getStartTime

        public long getStartTime()
        Returns:
        the overall start time of this clipin

      • getEndTime

        public long getEndTime()
        Returns:
        the overall end time of this clipin (or -1 if not finished)

      • getDuration

        public long getDuration()
        Returns:
        the overall duration of the clip-in (or -1 if not finished)

      • getCurrentStartTime

        public long getCurrentStartTime()
        Returns:
        the start time of this clip-in at its current task (or -1 if not initialized at a task)

      • getTimerInfo

        public TimerInfo[] getTimerInfo()
        Returns:
        an array of the timer infos generated by this clipin

      • getSortedTimerInfo

        public TimerInfo[] getSortedTimerInfo()
        Returns:
        an array of the timer infos generated by this clip-in sorted by start time

      • initializeAttach

        public void initializeAttach(AttachInfo info)
        This method is called before the clip-in enters a task's clip-in bucket. This occurs when either the data it is attached to is input by the task, or when the unit directly adds the clip-in to its bucket.
        Specified by:
        initializeAttach in interface ClipIn
        Parameters:
        info - info about the task the clip-in is being attached to

      • finalizeAttach

        public void finalizeAttach(AttachInfo info)
        This method is called when the clip-in is removed from a task's clip-in bucket. This occurs when either the data it is attached to is output by the task, or when the unit directly remove the clip-in from its bucket.
        Specified by:
        finalizeAttach in interface ClipIn
        Parameters:
        info - info about the task the clip-in is being removed from

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Clones the ClipIn to an identical one. This is a copy by value, not by reference. This method must be implemented for each class in a way that depends on the contents of the ClipIn.
        Specified by:
        clone in interface ClipIn
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a copy by value of the current ClipIn
